metadata.title: CVE-2024-24857 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the Linux kernel's net/bluetooth devicedriver in conn_info_{min,max}_age_set() function. This can result inintegrity overflow issue, possibly leading to bluetooth connectionabnormality or denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-24857` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-lowlatency - 4.4.0-257.291~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1134-aws - 4.4.0-1134.140
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
